thread.title_full: Danny Rose and Erik Lamela miss Tottenham training ahead of Gent Europa League clash | Football News | Sky Sports

author: Lyall Thomas
title: Danny Rose and Erik Lamela miss Tottenham training ahead of Gent Europa League clash | Football News | Sky Sports
text:
Danny Rose and Erik Lamela miss Tottenham training ahead of Gent Europa League clash By Lyall Thomas Last Updated: 22/02/17 12:20pm Erik Lamela and Danny Rose continue to recover from respective injuries Danny Rose and Erik Lamela did not train on Wednesday ahead of Tottenham's Europa League last-32 second leg against Gent. 
Left-back Rose has been sidelined with a knee injury since the Premier League draw at Sunderland in January. 
And Lamela, who had returned to first-team training several weeks ago, has been out since October with a hip problem. 
Promising youngster Marcus Edwards, who suffered a bad ankle injury earlier in the season, was involved with first-team training as he continues his return to fitness. 
Fellow youngsters Cameron Carter-Vickers and Kyle Walker-Peters were also involved ahead of the sold-out clash at Wembley Stadium on Thursday. Spurs players training this morning. Only Danny Rose & Erik Lamela missing #thfc pic.twitter.com/kg0mRbEd9s â€” Paul Gilmour (@skysportspaulg) February 22, 2017 
Spurs go into the game 1-0 down from the first leg in Belgium but on following a comprehensive 3-0 win over Championship side Fulham to reach the FA Cup quarter-finals. Also See:
